function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Unclear or unsupported factual statements about contagious diseases in the built environment.","Impact":"Misinformation could lead to ineffective mitigation strategies and increased risk of disease spread.","Mitigation":"Ensure that all factual statements are supported by reputable citations and evidence from the published literature.","Technologies":"Fact-checking tools and databases for verifying information.","People":"General public, public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Authors, publishers, fact-checkers"},{"Description":"Unbalanced or unjustified conclusions about disease propagation in the built environment.","Impact":"Inaccurate conclusions may lead to ineffective or harmful interventions.","Mitigation":"Conduct a balanced review of the literature, consider alternative viewpoints, and consult with experts in the field.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools for comprehensive review of literature and expert consultation platforms.","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, researchers","Owner":"Authors, researchers, peer reviewers"},{"Description":"Ineffective or impractical solutions for real-world challenges related to disease containment in the built environment.","Impact":"Implementation of ineffective solutions may worsen the spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Thoroughly assess the feasibility and practicality of proposed solutions through pilot studies and expert consultation.","Technologies":"Simulation and modeling software, data analytics for evidence-based decision making.","People":"Public health officials, architects, urban planners","Owner":"Researchers, public health officials, urban planning organizations"}]}
